name: Méki, o menino Guató
description:
Méki was a Guató boy who lived in the early 20th century, this illustration is inspired by a photo of him taken by anthropologist Max Schmidt. Unfortunately, he and several other people of this Brazilian Pantanal ethnic group died from an influenza epidemic, according to Schmidt's descriptions. There are currently only two Guató speakers left and the traditional songs have already been lost (when I did this painting, was three, REST IN PIECE EUFRÁSIA!), all due to the violence they have suffered for hundreds of years. Work in mixed technique, traditional drawing and digital painting.

100% profits of the first sells will be donated to the Piraquara's Take Back Area, where the original peoples leaders from my region, Kretã Kaingang and Eloy Jacintho, started to revive the State Forest.

this art is part of the Vienna's Brazilian Culture Festival 2021 exibhition.
